item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，特朗普称他倾向于由沃什或哈希特领导美联储
item.description: 华尔街日报》周五援引对特朗普的采访报道称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他倾向于由前美联储理事凯文-沃什（Kevin Warsh）或国家经济委员会主任凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）在明年领导美联储。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said he is leaning toward former Fed governor Kevin Warsh or National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett to lead the Federal Reserve next year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday citing an interview with Trump.】

item.title: 西南航空公司将于 2026 年在奥斯汀开设机组基地，创造 2000 个工作岗位
item.description: 美国西南航空公司周五表示，将于 2026 年 3 月在奥斯汀-伯格斯特罗姆国际机场开设一个机组人员基地，创造 2000 多个工作岗位，以扩大其在快速发展的得克萨斯州中部的业务范围。【原文：Southwest Airlines said on Friday it would open a crew base at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport in March 2026, creating more than 2,000 jobs as the carrier looks to expand its footprint in fast-growing central Texas.】

item.title: 加密货币集团 Tether 提交收购意大利尤文图斯足球俱乐部的报价
item.description: 加密货币集团 Tether 周五表示，它已向阿涅利家族的控股公司提交了一份全现金收购方案，以收购其在意大利历史上最成功的足球俱乐部尤文图斯（Juventus）的全部股份。【原文：Crypto group Tether said on Friday it has submitted an all-cash proposal to the holding company of the Agnelli family to buy its entire stake in Italy's most historically successful soccer club Juventus .】

item.title: 汽车零部件制造商 First Brands 任命 Charles Moore 为临时首席执行官
item.description: First Brands 周五表示，在破产重组过程中，公司已任命查尔斯-摩尔（Charles Moore）为临时首席执行官。【原文：First Brands said on Friday it has appointed Charles Moore as the interim chief executive amid its bankruptcy restructuring process.】

item.title: 特朗普的人工智能令面临政治和法律障碍
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的行政命令旨在禁止各州制定有关人工智能的法律，因为他认为这些法律会延缓创新。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order seeking to bar state laws on artificial intelligence that he says slow innovation will face political and legal opposition from states seeking to preserve their right to regulate the rapidly growing technology.】

item.title: 金融科技公司 Wealthfront 在纳斯达克上市，估值 26.3 亿美元
item.description: Wealthfront 周五在纳斯达克首次上市时股价开盘持平，按全面摊薄计算，这家自动化数字财富管理公司的估值为 26.3 亿美元。【原文：Wealthfront's shares opened flat in their Nasdaq debut on Friday, valuing the automated digital wealth management company at $2.63 billion on a fully diluted basis.】

item.title: 供应紧张和 AI 需求如何推动铜价飙升至 12,000 美元
item.description: 随着人工智能数据中心的需求预期飙升以及供应紧张与美国以外地区的短缺相冲突，铜价正逼近每吨 12,000 美元大关。【原文：Copper is closing in on the $12,000 a metric ton mark as expectations of soaring demand from data centres that power artificial intelligence and tight supplies collide with shortages outside the United States.】

item.title: 文件显示，在俄罗斯作出裁决后，谷歌面临 1.29 亿美元的法国资产冻结
item.description: 路透社看到的官方命令显示，谷歌已停业的俄罗斯业务管理人已获得临时冻结该 Alphabet 旗下公司在法国约 1.1 亿欧元（约合 1.29 亿美元）资产的许可。【原文：The administrator of Google's defunct Russian business has obtained a temporary freeze on some 110 million euros ($129 million) of the Alphabet-owned company's assets in France, official orders seen by Reuters show.】

item.title: 美国监管机构初步批准加密货币公司成立信托银行
item.description: 包括瑞波（Ripple）和圈子（Circle）在内的加密货币巨头周五获得了最高银行监管机构的初步批准，可以成立国家信托银行，这一重大举措将进一步把数字资产纳入银行系统。【原文：Crypto giants including Ripple and Circle on Friday received preliminary approval from a top banking regulator to establish national trust banks, in a major move that could further integrate digital assets into the banking system.】

item.title: 因美国牛肉供应不足，JBS 将关闭加利福尼亚牛肉工厂
item.description: 全球最大的肉类公司 JBS 周五表示，由于肉牛供应紧张导致肉类包装商成本上升，JBS 将永久关闭洛杉矶郊外的一家牛肉加工厂，该厂主要生产供美国杂货店销售的牛肉。【原文：JBS will permanently close a facility outside Los Angeles that prepares beef for sale at U.S. grocery stores, the world's largest meat company said on Friday, as tight cattle supplies have raised costs for meatpackers.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，甲骨文将用于 OpenAI 的多个数据中心推后至 2028 年
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引熟悉这项工作的人士的话报道，甲骨文公司已将其为OpenAI开发的一些数据中心的完工日期从2027年推迟到2028年。【原文：Oracle has pushed back the completion dates for some of the data centers it is developing for OpenAI to 2028 from 2027, Bloomberg News reported on Friday citing people familiar with the work.】

item.title: Rivian股价大涨，分析师欢呼转向定制自动驾驶芯片和人工智能战略
item.description: 周五，Rivian Automotive 的股价大涨 18%，原因是分析师对这家电动皮卡和 SUV 制造商开发用于自动驾驶功能的定制芯片以及整合人工智能的努力发表了看好的评论。【原文：Shares of Rivian Automotive surged 18% on Friday as analysts issued bullish commentary on the electric pickup truck and SUV maker's efforts to develop a custom chip for self-driving features and its integration of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 花旗集团的扭亏进展获得摩根大通赞赏
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）分析师周五上调了花旗集团（Citigroup）的评级，华尔街券商对这家美国第三大银行在首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）领导下长达数年的扭亏为盈努力投下了信任票。【原文：Citigroup was upgraded by analysts at J.P. Morgan on Friday, in a vote of confidence from the Wall Street brokerage for the third-largest U.S. lender's years-long turnaround efforts under CEO Jane Fraser.】

item.title: 鉴于通胀过高，美联储哈马克倾向于收紧政策
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周五表示，鉴于她本人对经济的看法，她倾向于货币政策比目前更为紧缩。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said Friday that given her own take on the economy she would prefer monetary policy to be tighter than it is currently.】

item.title: 冰淇淋分拆让联合利华面临实现增长和利润的压力
item.description: 随着 The Magnum 冰淇淋公司的供应链寒流过去，联合利华面临着压力，必须证明其向美容和健康的转变能够促进增长和提高利润率。【原文：With The Magnum Ice Cream Company's supply-chain chills gone, the pressure is on Unilever to show that its shift towards beauty and wellbeing can fire up growth and margins.】

item.title: Netflix 与华纳兄弟 720 亿美元的交易因 YouTube 竞争而面临质疑
item.description: Netflix 称其必须收购华纳兄弟发现公司才能与 YouTube 竞争，但反垄断专家怀疑监管机构是否会接受这一说法。 这家流媒体巨头以 720 亿美元收购华纳兄弟 Discovery 旗下的工作室和 HBO Max，鉴于其规模和合并后的 4.28 亿用户，将面临美国和全球监管机构的审查。 Netflix 坚称，需要通过这笔交易来挑战 Alphabet 旗下的 YouTube，媒体分析公司尼尔森（Nielsen）将 YouTube 评为美国收视率最高的电视媒体。但律师表示，鉴于 Netflix 和 YouTube 不同的内容、受众和商业模式，司法部不太可能将它们视为可以互换的竞争对手。【原文：Netflix says it must acquire Warner Bros Discovery to compete with YouTube, but antitrust experts doubt regulators will buy that argument. The streaming giant’s $72 billion takeover of Warner Bros Discovery’s studios and HBO Max will face scrutiny from U.S. and global regulators, given its scale and the combined 428 million subscribers. Netflix insists the deal is needed to challenge Alphabet’s YouTube, which media analysis firm Nielsen ranks as America’s most-watched TV distributor. But attorneys say the Justice Department is unlikely to see Netflix and YouTube as interchangeable rivals, given their different content, audiences and business models.】

item.title: 潜在客户退出融资交易后，数据中心 REIT 费米暴跌 40
item.description: 周五，Fermi 公司股价暴跌 40%，原因是这家数据中心房地产投资公司称，一家潜在租户已终止了为其德克萨斯基地的建设提供资金的协议，这给这家新上市的公司带来了挫折。【原文：Shares of Fermi plunged 40% on Friday after the data center real estate investment company said a prospective tenant had terminated a deal to help fund construction at its Texas site, dealing a setback to the newly listed firm.】

item.title: 巴西部长称将于 3 月初拍卖桑托斯大型集装箱码头
item.description: 巴西港口和机场部长 Silvio Costa Filho 周五表示，巴西联邦政府计划在 3 月上半月拍卖桑托斯港大型 Tecon 10 集装箱码头。【原文：Brazil's federal government plans to hold the auction of Santos port's massive Tecon 10 container terminal in the first half of March, Ports and Airports Minister Silvio Costa Filho said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局将对 MAX 10 的波音驾驶舱警报系统进行审查
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周五表示，将对波音公司为波音 737 MAX 10 提议的增强型机组人员警报系统进行审查，该系统将包括一个合成增强攻击角系统和一种关闭失速警告和超速警报的方法。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Friday it will review Boeing's proposed enhanced flight crew alerting system for the Boeing 737 MAX 10, which will include a synthetic enhanced angle-of-attack system and a means to shut off stall warning and overspeed alerts.】

item.title: 西雅特称欧盟撤销内燃机禁令将有助于电动汽车转型
item.description: 欧盟委员会预计将决定撤销从2035年起禁止销售内燃机新车的禁令，这将有助于大众汽车旗下的西班牙汽车制造商西雅特（SEAT）过渡到电动汽车，该公司首席执行官周五告诉路透社记者。【原文：The European Commission's expected decision to reverse its ban on selling new cars with combustion engines from 2035 will help Spanish automaker SEAT, a unit of Volkswagen , transition to electric vehicles, its CEO told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 顾问称白宫将与国会合作制定人工智能单一框架
item.description: 白宫顾问斯里拉姆-克里希南（Sriram Krishnan）周五告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNBC），特朗普政府将在未来几周和几个月内与国会合作，制定一个单一的国家框架来规范人工智能（AI）领域的发展。【原文：The Trump administration will work with Congress in coming weeks and months to craft a single national framework to regulate developments in the field of artificial intelligence (AI), White House adviser Sriram Krishnan told CNBC on Friday.】

item.title: Lululemon CEO离职，回归基本面，燃起重新出发的希望
item.description: Lululemon Athletica 的股价在周五的盘前交易中大涨 10%，原因是首席执行官的调整引发了人们对这家瑜伽服生产商扭亏为盈的希望，这家公司希望重振其低迷的美国业务，并赢回年轻、富裕的购物者。【原文：Lululemon Athletica's shares surged 10% in premarket trading on Friday as a CEO shake-up sparked hopes of a turnaround at the yogawear maker looking to revive its sluggish U.S. business and win back younger, affluent shoppers.】

item.title: 欧盟委员会支持扩大礼来糖尿病药物在 10 岁及以上儿童中的使用范围
item.description: 欧洲药品管理局委员会周五建议延长礼来公司大片药物 Mounjaro 在 10 岁及以上青少年和儿童 2 型糖尿病治疗中的使用期限。【原文：The European Medicines Agency's committee on Friday recommended extending the use of Eli Lilly's blockbuster drug Mounjaro for the treatment of type 2 diabetes in adolescents and children aged 10 years and above.】

item.title: 环球公司就欧盟对市中心协议的反对意见提交补救措施
item.description: 环球音乐公司（Universal Music）周五表示，它已提交了一份补救措施，以解决欧盟委员会对该集团斥资 7.75 亿美元收购 Downtown Music 引起的竞争问题。【原文：Universal Music said on Friday it has submitted a remedy to address competition concerns from the European Commission over the group's $775-million takeover of Downtown Music.】

item.title: 吉利启动耗资 2.84 亿美元的汽车安全测试设施
item.description: 中国吉利汽车公司周五启动了一个耗资 2.84 亿美元的设施，为整个汽车行业提供安全测试，以满足国内外监管机构和消费者对提高汽车质量和可靠性日益增长的需求。【原文：China's Geely Auto on Friday launched a $284 million facility providing safety tests for the automotive industry in general in anticipation of growing demand at home and abroad from regulators and consumers for improved vehicle quality and reliability.】

item.title: 中国长安汽车将意大利和西班牙纳入其欧洲市场
item.description: 中国汽车制造商长安汽车将进军意大利和西班牙，推出两款全电动车型，明年还将推出插电式混合动力车型。【原文：Chinese automaker Changan Automobile is expanding into Italy and Spain with the launch of two fully electric models, followed next year by their plug-in hybrid versions.】

item.title: 美联储保尔森称货币政策仍能抑制通胀
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长安娜-保尔森（Anna Paulson）周五表示，她目前最关心的是就业市场的状况，她在讲话中还表示，当前的货币政策状况应有助于将通胀率降至美联储2%的目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Anna Paulson said Friday her main concern right now is the state of the job market, in remarks that also said the current state of monetary policy should help bring down inflation to the Fed’s 2% target.】

item.title: 纳斯达克提交新计划，赋予其阻止易受操纵 IPO 的更大权力
item.description: 纳斯达克周五提交了一份新规则，允许交易所在发现可能导致公司股票易受操纵的红旗时，即使公司符合所有上市标准，也可阻止首次公开募股。【原文：Nasdaq filed a new rule on Friday that would allow the exchange to block IPOs even when companies meet all listing standards if it detects red flags that could make a company's stock vulnerable to manipulation.】

item.title: 美联储反对者在投票反对降息时提到通胀风险
item.description: 本周投票反对美国央行降息的美联储官员周五表示，他们担心通胀率仍然过高，以至于无法降低借贷成本，尤其是考虑到近期缺乏有关物价上涨速度的官方数据。【原文：Federal Reserve officials who voted against the U.S. central bank's interest rate cut this week said on Friday they are worried that inflation remains too high to warrant lower borrowing costs, particularly given the lack of recent official data about the pace of price increases.】

item.title: 独家报道中国需求强劲，Nvidia 考虑增加 H200 芯片产量
item.description: 此举是在唐纳德-特朗普总统表示美国政府将允许 Nvidia 出口 H200 处理器之后采取的。【原文：The move comes after President Donald Trump said the U.S. government would allow Nvidia to export H200 processors.】
